page.title: 17SOUTH HORNBY:Housing
page.content: Lunesdale Court,called"The Hostel"by locals and built by Lancashire C.C. about 1864 at the southern end of Horn- by operated as a workhouse until 1935. Lunesdale Rural District Council bought it in 1938 to convert into houses.In- stead during the war it housed 20 eva- cuee children and a WVS clothing depot. When Lunesdale R.D.C.offices in Hornby Hall were burned down in 1946 the coun- cil took over part of the building and the remainder in 1950 when the children left.In 1974,with local government re- organisation Lancaster City Coucil took over the R.D.C.and Lunesdale Publishing Group and Constuction Press occupied the building to 1982.It was bought by a building group and converted into 16x2, 3 and 4 bedroomed houses and flats.Two converted farm buildings of the former Butt Yeats Farm and a row of 1950's council houses mark the village end.
